HabitX needs camera access to scan barcodes for books and food items, take progress photos, and log meals visually. This helps you track your habits more efficiently.
HabitX uses microphone access to record voice notes in your journal entries and provide guided meditation instructions. Your voice data is processed locally for privacy.
HabitX needs access to your photo library to save progress photos, meal images, and customize your avatar. This helps track your journey visually.
HabitX wants to save photos to your library including progress photos, meal logs, and achievement screenshots.
HabitX uses your location to provide contextual reminders like "time for a walk" when you're at the office, or gym check-ins when nearby. Location data is used only when the app is active.
HabitX can provide location-based reminders even when the app is in the background, helping you stay consistent with location-specific habits.
HabitX can access your contacts to help you find friends who are also using the app and invite them to participate in challenges together.
HabitX can schedule your habits and tasks directly in your calendar for better time management and organization. This integration is optional but helps with planning.
HabitX can read your health data from the Health app to automatically track fitness activities, sleep patterns, and wellness metrics for comprehensive habit tracking.
HabitX can write fitness and wellness data to the Health app, allowing other health apps to access your habit tracking progress.
HabitX uses motion data to automatically detect workouts and physical activities, helping track your fitness habits without manual input.
HabitX sends notifications to remind you about habits, task deadlines, and focus sessions. You have full control over which notifications you receive.
